Definition: a primitive root; to flow freely (as water), i.e. (specifically) to have a (sexual) flux; figuratively, to waste away; also to overflow; flow, gush out, have a (running) issue, pine away, run.
a primitive root; to be (or become) pregnant, conceive (literally or figuratively); been, be with child, conceive, progenitor.
feminine of {{h2027}}; slaughter; slaughter.
from {{h2022}} and {{h410}}; mount of God; figuratively, the altar of burnt-offering; altar. Compare {{h739}}.
perhaps from {{h2022}}; mountainousness; Hara, a region of Media; Hara.
from {{h2026}}; slaughter; be slain, slaughter.
a primitive root; to smite with deadly intent; destroy, out of hand, kill, murder(-er), put to (death), make (slaughter), slay(-er), × surely.
from an unused root meaning apparently to be sharp or strong; a weapon of war; chariot.
from {{h5337}}; rescue; deliverance.
another form of {{h2022}}; mountain; Hor, the name of a peak in Idumaea and of one in Syria; Hor.
a shortened form of {{h2042}}; a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively); hill (country), mount(-ain), × promotion.
from the same as {{h2036}}; a castle (from its height); palace.
perhaps from {{h2022}}; mountaineer; Haran, the name of two men; Haran.
from an unused root (meaning to tower up); high; Horam, a Canaanitish king; Horam.
passive participle of the same as {{h2036}}; high; Harum, an Israelite; Harum.
from {{h2040}}; something demolished; ruin.
from {{h2040}}; demolition; destruction.
or הֵרָיוֹן; from {{h2029}}; pregnancy; conception.
another form for {{h2043}}; a Harorite or mountaineer; Harorite.
or הָרִי; (Hosea 14:1), from {{h2029}}; pregnant; (be, woman) with child, conceive, × great.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to {{h2029}}; a mental conception; thought.
prolongation for {{h2005}}; lo!; behold, lo, see.
from {{h2004}}; hither or thither (but used both of place and time); here, hither(-to), now, on this (that) side,   since, this (that) way, thitherward,   thus far, to...fro,   yet.
from an unused root apparently meaning to crackle; a dry twig or brushwood; melting.
(Aramaic) but the text is הֲמוּנֵךְ; of foreign origin; a necklace; chain.
of foreign derivation; Haman, a Persian vizier; Haman.

prolongation for {{h2004}}; themselves (often used emphatic for the copula, also in indirect relation); × in, × such (and such things), their, (into) them, thence, therein, these, they (had), on this side, whose, wherein.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h2005}}; lo! also there(-fore), (un-) less, whether, but, if; (that) if, or, whether.
a primitive particle; lo!; also (as expressing surprise) if; behold, if, lo, though.
feminine plural from {{h1931}}; they (only used when emphatic); × in, such like, (with) them, thereby, therein, (more than) they, wherein, in which, whom, withal.
the same as {{h2073}}; dwelling; Zebul, an Israelite; Zebul. Compare {{h2073}}.
a primitive root; apparently properly, to inclose, i.e.; to reside; dwell with.
from an unused root (meaning to purchase); gainfulness; Zebina, an Israelite; Zebina.
feminine from {{h2064}}; giving; Zebidah, an Israelitess; Zebudah.
from {{h2102}}; arrogance; presumptuously, pride, proud (man).
from {{h2102}}; arrogant; presumptuous, proud.
from an unused root probably meaning to inclose; the skin of a grape; husk.
(Aramaic) corresponding to the root of {{h2081}}; to acquire by purchase; gain.
(1 Samuel by permutation for {{h7716}}; a sheep; lamb.

a primitive word; the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that; he, × hence, × here, it(-self), × now, × of him, the one...the other, × than the other, (× out of) the (self) same, such (a one) that, these, this (hath, man), on this side...on that side, × thus, very, which. Compare {{h2063}}, {{h2090}}, {{h2097}}, {{h2098}}.
from {{h6313}}; relaxation; intermission.

a primitive root; to turn about or over; by implication, to change, overturn, return, pervert; × become, change, come, be converted, give, make (a bed), overthrow (-turn), perverse, retire, tumble, turn (again, aside, back, to the contrary, every way).
; or הֵפֶךְ; from {{h2015}}; a turn, i.e. the reverse; contrary.
from {{h2015}}; an upset, i.e. (abstract) perversity; turning of things upside down.
from {{h5117}}; permission of rest, i.e. quiet; release.
probably of foreign origin; Hinnom, apparently a Jebusite; Hinnom.
probably of foreign derivation; Hena, a place apparently in Mesopotamia; Hena.
a primitive root; to hush; hold peace (tongue), (keep) silence, be silent, still.
feminine of {{h2016}}; destruction; overthrow.
by reduplication from {{h2015}}; very perverse; froward.
for {{h2088}}; this or that; that, this, × wherein, which, whom.
probably from an unused root meaning to be prominent; properly, brightness (compare {{h2122}}), i.e. (figuratively) the month of flowers; Ziv (corresponding to Ijar or May); Zif.
a primitive root; to gleam; figuratively, to enlighten (by caution); admonish, shine, teach, (give) warn(-ing).
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h2094}}; (passively) be admonished; take heed.
from {{h2094}}; brilliancy; brightness.
for {{h2088}}; this or that; that, this.
for {{h2088}}; this or that; as well as another, it, this, that, thus and thus.
from an unused root meaning to shimmer; gold, figuratively, something gold-colored (i.e. yellow), as oil, a clear sky; gold(-en), fair weather.
a primitive root; to be rancid, i.e. (transitively) to loathe; abhor.
from {{h2092}}; loathing; Zaham, an Israelite; Zaham.
from an unused root meaning to be yellow; a wolf; wolf.
of Persian origin; Vashti, the queen of Xerxes; Vashti. z
irregular feminine of {{h2088}}; this (often used adverb); hereby (-in, -with), it, likewise, the one (other, same), she, so (much), such (deed), that, therefore, these, this (thing), thus.
the same as {{h2061}}; Zeeb, a Midianitish prince; Zeeb.
from {{h2064}}; a gift; dowry.
a primitive root; to confer; endure.
from {{h2065}}; giving; Zabdi, the name of four Israelites; Zabdi.
from {{h2064}}; giver; Zabad, the name of seven Israelites; Zabad.
or זְבַדְיָהוּ; from {{h2064}} and {{h3050}}; Jah has given; Zebadjah, the name of nine Israelites; Zebadiah.
from {{h2065}} and {{h410}}; gift of God; Zabdiel, the name of two Israelites; Zabdiel.
a form of {{h2071}}; given; Zabbud, an Israelite; Zabbud.
or זְבֻל; from {{h2082}}; a residence; dwell in, dwelling, habitation.
from an unused root (meaning to flit); a fly (especially one of a stinging nature); fly.
from {{h2064}}; given, Zabud, an Israelite; Zabud.
a primitive root; to slaughter an animal (usually in sacrifice); kill, offer, (do) sacrifice, slay.
from {{h2076}}; properly, a slaughter, i.e. the flesh of an animal; by implication, a sacrifice (the victim or the act); offer(-ing), sacrifice.
or זְבֻלוּן; or זְבוּלֻן; from {{h2082}}; habitation; Zebulon, a son of Jacob; also his territory and tribe; Zebulun.
patronymically from {{h2074}}; a Zebulonite or descendant of Zebulun; Zebulonite.
the same as {{h2077}}; sacrifice; Zebach, a Midianitish prince; Zebah.
probably by orthographical error for {{h2140}}; Zabbai (or Zaccai), an Israelite; Zabbai.
from {{h2048}} (only in plural collectively); a derision; mocker.
a primitive root; to deride; by implication, to cheat; deal deceitfully, deceive, mock.
probably of foreign origin; Hathak, a Persian eunuch; Hatach.
from {{h5413}}; a melting; is melted.
from {{h8085}}; announcement; to cause to hear.
perhaps from the same as {{h2828}}; wealthy; Hashem, an Israelite; Hashem.
or הָרָרִי; (2 Samuel 23:11), or הָארָרִי; (2 Samuel 23:34, last clause), apparently from {{h2042}}; a mountaineer; Hararite.
from an unused root meaning to loom up; a mountain; hill, mount(-ain).
from {{h2040}}; demolition; destruction.
a primitive root; to pull down or in pieces, break, destroy; beat down, break (down, through), destroy, overthrow, pluck down, pull down, ruin, throw down, × utterly.
probably from {{h3254}}; additional; Vophsi, an Israelite; Vophsi.
probably from {{h3461}}; weak; Vashni, an Israelite; Vashni.
a primitive root; properly, to break in upon, i.e. to assail; imagine mischief.
perhaps for {{h5730}}; Vedan (or Aden), a place in Arabia; Dan also.
of uncertain derivation; Vaheb, a place in Moab; what he did.
probably; a hook (the name of the sixth Hebrew letter); hook.
presumed to be from an unused root meaning to bear guilt; crime; × strange.
of foreign origin; Vajezatha, a son of Haman; Vajezatha.
for {{h3206}}; a boy; child.
perhaps for {{h6043}}; Vanjah, an Israelite; Vaniah.
